item.title: Why the 'Prince Andrew problem' is one King Charles 'has to confront'
item.description: In a week where King Charles said he hoped to project unity as a "bulwark against those promoting conflict, division and tyranny", his scandal-ridden brother reigned supreme.

item.title: The Hobart Clinic failed an audit before CEO was fired and board attempted to wind it up, documents show
item.description: Documents obtained by the ABC show a failed audit at Tasmania's only large-scale private mental health facility, claims that staff concerns were ignored, and the lead-up to the departure of its CEO.

item.title: Analysts say gold chasing shares to record highs is eroding its crucial safe haven status
item.description: A major investment bank says gold is following share markets higher. While the precious metal consistently pushes record highs, it suggests the gold price could continue to rise substantially. But what's really at stake?

item.title: MS is not holding Lynda MacCallum back from staying in the saddle
item.description: Told she would never ride again after a multiple sclerosis diagnosis, horse trainer Lynda MacCallum is still defying the odds seven years later.

item.title: The unexpected hurdle meaning a NSW musician is ineligible for a government grant
item.description: Jennifer Hankin was hoping to apply for a NSW government grant program to support local recording artists so she could finally release her EP.

item.title: AI robots enlisted in fight against sea urchin surge along Australia's east coast
item.description: A hidden environmental crisis lurks beneath the crystal clear waters of Australia's east coast as long-spined sea urchins wreak havoc on the coast. Now scientists are trialling a new solution.

item.title: Nine candidates running for Townsville mayor at postal by-election
item.description: Townsville residents will select from a field of nine candidates at a mayoral by-election next month.

item.title: Best books out in October, from Jane Harper, Kiran Desai, Bri Lee and more
item.description: Wondering what to read? This month's best books include the latest from Jane Harper, Bri Lee and Booker Prize winner Kiran Desai.

item.title: Tasmania remains free of H5 bird flu, but returning migratory birds could pose a risk
item.description: With migratory birds returning to Tasmania during a period of increased bird flu, the chance of the virus affecting the state's coastal areas is on the rise.

item.title: How the star of lost silent film Jewelled Nights went from the limelight to selling sweets for cinemagoers
item.description: Australia's first Hollywood star, a famous romance novel by Joh Bjelke-Petersen's aunt and a rare alloy mined from Tasmania's west coast put the island's wild places on the big screen.

item.title: Fire ant eradication program under scrutiny as woman left fighting infestation alone
item.description: A Queensland woman says she has been left to fight a fire ant infestation with virtually no support, as experts warn funding gaps and slow responses risk wider spread.

item.title: Alex de Minaur beats Matteo Berrettini in Vienna, sets up Jannik Sinner clash for place in final
item.description: Alex de Minaur reaches his 30th ATP tour semifinal in Vienna with a big win over Matteo Berrettini -- but he will have to get past his nemesis Jannik Sinner for a place in the final.

item.title: Message in a bottle from WWI soldier in 1916 found on Esperance beach
item.description: A century-old message in a bottle from a World War I soldier to his mother has been found on a beach in Western Australia's south.

item.title: Nationwide Bug Hunt to capture Australia's insect, invertebrate underworld
item.description: Australia's photographic natural database is about to get a big boost as citizen scientists are urged to join a national search.

item.title: 'Castle Law' petition closes with record support in Queensland
item.description: A second attempt to put "castle law" before Queensland parliament has generated record support, with some legal experts concerned.

item.title: Trailblazing mining engineer remembered as pioneering transgender woman
item.description: The mining industry is notoriously "bloke-centred". Rebecca Norton transitioned gender and kept going.

item.title: NSW seeks federal support for world-first mRNA foot and mouth disease vaccine
item.description: Scientists in NSW develop a potential world-first mRNA vaccine to protect cattle from foot and mouth disease.

item.title: What does it mean if a deadly strain of bird flu has been found on Australia's Heard Island?
item.description: Scientists suspect a deadly strain of bird flu, H5N1, has infected wildlife on Heard Island after observing a high mortality rate in elephant seals on the Australian territory in the sub-Antarctic.

item.title: Sam Kerr set for Matildas return against Wales after nearly two years out with injury
item.description: Sam Kerr is back with the Matildas and ready to start taking big steps towards a dream of lifting silverware with the current group of players.

item.title: Menindee Lakes birdwatcher, the 'Birdman', has recorded 200-plus bird species
item.description: For 50 years Geoff Looney has called the remote Indigenous community of Menindee in Far West New South Wales home. Thirty years ago he started recording information about birdlife in the region which has grown to more than 209 species recorded.

item.title: Perth Festival venues include vacant offices, bridges, secret locations in 2026
item.description: Perth Festival unveils a diverse program making use of unconventional event spaces, but large-scale opening and closing events are markedly missing this year.

item.title: Thailand's Queen Mother Sirikit dies after blood infection, aged 93
item.description: Sirikit, who succumbed to a blood infection, is remembered as a champion of the poor.

item.title: Study tracks how foxes 'colonised' Australia and grew to a population of 1.7 million
item.description: A nationwide program has traced how foxes spread from south-eastern Australia to as far away as the Pilbara in just 70 years, as part of efforts to revive native species populations decimated by the pest.

item.title: Surfing with the Mob connects Indigenous teens to country and language on NSW far south coast
item.description: It started with a surf lesson, but these these Indigenous teens found something far deeper in the ocean.

item.title: Jon Bon Jovi uses football analogy to describe vocal surgery rehab — and meets the Kangaroos
item.description: The US rocker says getting back to form after the surgical procedure was a long, slow process.

item.title: Bon Jovi meets Australia's national rugby league team
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Kangaroos vs England, kick-off time and how to watch, Australia meets Bon Jovi at Wembley before Ashes Test
item.description: The countdown is on for the first Ashes series in 22 years, as the Kangaroos look to retain the title they have held since 1973.

item.title: Marking 40 years since the historic handback of Uluṟu-Kata Tjuṯa
item.description: When you drive towards Uluṟu and see the stark, red monolith on the horizon, or stand at its base and look up at its striking, powerful enormity, time stands still.

item.title: Perth Zoo's Sumatran tiger Jaya dies of cancer, seven years after tumour removed
item.description: Perth Zoo's beloved Sumatran tiger Jaya dies, seven years after being diagnosed with cancer and nine years after his mother also died of the disease.

item.title: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma lead India to nine-wicket victory over Australia in third ODI
item.description: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma conclude their Australian farewell tour with an unbeaten 169-run partnership in India's commanding nine-wicket victory at the Sydney Cricket Ground.

item.title: Swans keep season alive with 17-point defeat of Eagles as Hawks, Lions and Dockers notch victories
item.description: The Sydney Swans beat the West Coast Eagles by 17 points to keep their hopes of playing in this year's AFLW finals series alive, while Fremantle, Brisbane and Hawthorn also pick up wins.

item.title: Apartment construction scheme unveiled by SA government ahead of 2026 election
item.description: A scheme to increase housing supply by boosting confidence in apartment construction projects in Adelaide's CBD has been unveiled by the SA government as a major election commitment — but the opposition has questioned the affordability of the proposal.

item.title: Wallabies defeat Eddie Jones's Brave Blossoms 19-15 in opening Test of spring tour
item.description: In the first stop on their spring tour, the Wallabies hold on for a gritty 19-15 victory over Japan in wet conditions at Tokyo's National Stadium.

item.title: Halloween toys fail safety tests, prompting warning to parents
item.description: Authorities warn parents of the dangers of Halloween-themed toys bought online, after testing reveals 80 per cent fail to meet safety and information standards.

item.title: Donald Trump says he does not forget when people 'say bad' about him, in response to question about Kevin Rudd
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he does not forget when people "say bad" things about him, in response to a question about Australia's ambassador, Kevin Rudd.

item.title: Cricket Australia says two Women's World Cup members were 'touched inappropriately' in India
item.description: Cricket Australia says two members of the Australian Women's World Cup cricket team have been "touched inappropriately" in India.

item.title: Worker dies at Merredin grain property owned by WA farmer John Nicoletti
item.description: A man in his 60s died at a property owned by prominent farmer John Nicoletti in Western Australia's Wheatbelt.

item.title: Alana King spins Australia to crushing seven-wicket victory against South Africa in ODI World Cup
item.description: Alana King claims the best figures by an Australian woman in ODI history as Australia defeats South Africa by seven wickets to book a semi-final clash with India.

item.title: 'Change is hard, but progress occurs': Albanese chats land rights on NT visit
item.description: Crowds gather to celebrate the anniversary of a pivotal moment in the Aboriginal land rights movements, as the prime minister speaks from Uluṟu for the first time since the failed referendum.

item.title: Matildas beat Wales 2-1 in Cardiff as Sam Kerr makes successful return from injury
item.description: Sam Kerr makes a successful return to action with the Matildas, starting and playing an hour in Australia's 2-1 win over Wales.

item.title: Kangaroos crush England 26-6 to claim 1-0 series lead in rugby league Ashes series at Wembley stadium
item.description: Reece Walsh scored two tries and saved two more as the Kangaroos belted England 26-6 in front of a record crowd at Wembley Stadium in London.

item.title: Year 12 exams have started for the Class of 2025 who began high school in COVID lockdown
item.description: They started high school as the world went into lockdown, interrupting their young lives at a pivotal moment. Now they’re graduating year 12 and figuring out what to do next.

item.title: Myanmar too low on agenda as regional leaders meet Trump for summit
item.description: Instead of talking about Myanmar, the US president and his regional counterparts will be congratulating themselves for helping Thailand and Cambodia strike a peace deal.

item.title: Prince Andrew has been excised from the royal family. Should the monarchy do more?
item.description: The Prince Andrew debacle is shameful for the monarchy — it's not a pile-on, it's alleged paedophilia. So should the royals do more, here?

item.title: Shooter Jennings releases unheard Waylon Jennings recordings on new album Songbird
item.description: Shooter Jennings unearthed a treasure trove of unreleased recordings from his legendary father Waylon, revealing a tender, soulful side of the outlaw icon that history forgot.

item.title: Amid anger over corruption and inequality, Asia's gen Z turns on political 'nepo babies'
item.description: Gen Zs in several Asian countries launch an online war against political "nepo babies" who flaunt their wealth on social media.

item.title: DV victim and Brisbane Lions member calls for more privacy after alleged stalking incident
item.description: Two years after she took out a domestic violence order against her ex-partner, Aurora realised he was working 10m from her reserved seat at the Gabba — she believes he accessed her details by calling the club’s membership line.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani may soon be NYC's first Muslim millennial mayor. It's part of his appeal
item.description: If Zohran Mamdani wins, he will become New York's first Muslim and millennial mayor. It's something his campaign has been acutely aware of as he taps into new voting bases.

item.title: Farmers buy local pub to help foster connection in country NSW
item.description: Operating a pub is no mean feat, but try doing it while running a farm at the same time. That is exactly what farmers Karen and Rowan Alcock have done in their town of Bemboka on the New South Wales far south coast.

item.title: Alex de Minaur loses to Jannik Sinner in Vienna Open semifinal
item.description: Alex de Minaur's Vienna Open ends at the semifinal stage, with the Australian falling to world number one Jannik Sinner for the 12th time in as many meetings.

item.title: Lauren Huxley's brutal attacker Robert Black Farmer is up for parole next year
item.description: It has been 20 years since Lauren Huxley was brutally attacked in her home as a teen in a crime that shocked Australia. She has built a life no-one thought possible, but now her hard-won peace could be tested.

item.title: Tens of thousands pack stadium for Punjabi singer Diljit Dosanjh's Western Sydney show
item.description: The pop sensation has an army of fans all over the world who see him as an artist who bridges cultural gaps — Diljit Dosanjh's music loved by both Indians and non-Indians alike.

item.title: Runner Sissy Austin reunited with paramedic who helped her after horrific assault near Ballarat
item.description: When Sissy Austin, a young Aboriginal woman, was left dizzied and bloodied by an unprovoked assault while running, a small gesture from an attending paramedic helped her feel safe. It's a lesson that underpins a small but significant change in how paramedics treat patients across Victoria.

item.title: Hard Quiz: Convinced your losing streak is finally over? We'll see about that
item.description: We both know you're hoping for the best with this week's quiz. Just remember, hope will get you nowhere.

item.title: Will the art of biography be lost when AI and algorithms control our data?
item.description: How will the work of biographers change as letters, diaries and photographs are replaced by emails, texts and snapshots on the cloud?

item.title: Thai cave rescuer Richard Harris explores risk-taking in the film Deeper
item.description: A new documentary by director Jennifer Peedom delves deep into the attraction of cave diving, and why Richard Harris says risk-taking is crucial for resilience.

item.title: Logan City Council resident concerned about flood map accuracy as review draws to a close
item.description: Concerns that draft flood maps don't reflect historical accounts from residents have informed some of the submissions.

item.title: Trump punishes Canada with 10pc tariff increase over TV ad stoush
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he plans to hike tariffs on imports of Canadian goods by an extra 10 per cent because of an anti-tariff television ad aired by the province of Ontario.

item.title: Staff at Tasmania's public hospitals say physical and verbal abuse a normalised part of the job
item.description: Staff at Tasmania's public hospital emergency departments say they experience violence and aggression "all the time". Data released under right to information laws shows how often these incidents are occurring.

item.title: Walking netball adaptation helping players stay on the court
item.description: Before they take the court, the Magnolias strap on knee braces and tie bows in their hair. But don't be deceived, they're playing one of the 'most competitive games', and there may be elbows thrown.

item.title: Return to traditional birthing practices brings joy to Bundjalung mothers, elders
item.description: Bundjalung babies get the ceremonial treatment as proud elders welcome them to country for the first time.

item.title: Ancient tree stumps showing sea level change exposed on popular Esperance beach
item.description: Harsh winter weather has exposed almost 100 preserved trees from an ancient wetland on an Esperance beach, but there are fears over protecting the site on a popular four-wheel drive stretch.

item.title: Soccer program creates change for young people in remote communities
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Father and son grow delicate citrus blossoms for niche liqueur market
item.description: Farmers and distillers collaborate to capture a delicate flower's flavour for the boutique drinks market.

item.title: June Lockhart, beloved mother figure from Lassie and Lost In Space, dies aged 100
item.description: Lockhart died on Thursday of natural causes at her home in Santa Monica, a family spokesperson says.

item.title: Albany woman wins international wildlife photography award for second time
item.description: An Albany photographer has won an international wildlife photo award for her image of a five-headed caterpillar that was in her backyard.

item.title: Driving simulator assists people with disabilities to get behind the wheel
item.description: More than 20 regional NDIS clients have gone on to get their L-plates since completing a course with a unique driving simulator.

item.title: Exoskeletons including high-tech glove trialled to reduce workplace injuries
item.description: An ordinary worker puts on a power suit and gains extra strength. It sounds like the plot of a superhero film, but this is no work of fiction.

item.title: In the housing debate between NIMBYs and YIMBYs, a map of Sydney shows what's at stake
item.description: In the debate about Sydney's housing situation and the protection of the city's heritage buildings and suburbs, there's a map that does the rounds.

item.title: Nationals' net zero review has not undertaken economic modelling
item.description: Nationals Senator Matt Canavan will present parts of his and Ross Cadell's net zero review to the party room when parliament resumes on Monday.

item.title: Tiny home dream shattered for WA woman with epilepsy as council orders removal
item.description: A tiny home which began as a dream for Kathryn Payne becomes little more than a $130,000 storage unit in her dad's front yard as a local council in Perth's north demands the structure be removed.

item.title: 10yo boy holds toy train exhibition at local pub to raise funds for sick children
item.description: In the main room of a local pub in the western Victorian town of Natimuk, Brock Mewett shows off his toy trains to raise money for the Royal Children's Hospital.

item.title: 11yo boy from West Australia's Wheatbelt restores FJ45 LandCruiser
item.description: After-school restoration fun wins 11-year-old Wheatbelt mini-mechanic Harry Strange best in show.

item.title: Kamala Harris says she may run for US presidency again but hasn't made up her mind
item.description: The former US vice-president won't commit to making another bid for the White House yet, but reiterates she's "not done" with public service.

item.title: Meet the 2025 Agrifutures Rural Women's Award national finalists
item.description: Meet the national finalists in the running for the 2025 AgriFutures Rural Women's Award celebrating change-makers in rural, regional and remote Australia.

item.title: Reece Walsh hailed a 'freak of a player' after Kangaroos defeat England 26-6 in first Ashes Test
item.description: Nathan Cleary and Cameron Munster heap praise on Kangaroos teammate Reece Walsh following his stunning Test debut against England at Wembley.

item.title: Anthony Albanese dismisses lingering questions about relationship between Donald Trump and Kevin Rudd
item.description: The prime minister batted away concerns over Kevin Rudd's future after Donald Trump said he does not forget when people "say bad" things about him.

item.title: What you told us about receiving mail for a previous home owner or renter
item.description: From feeling "harassed" to fraudulent activity, this is what you had to say about how receiving mail that is not yours has impacted your life.

item.title: Australia's Diamonds lose to New Zealand's Silver Ferns 61-52 in Constellation Cup third Test
item.description: Australia misses the chance of wrapping up the Constellation Cup in the third Test, with New Zealand recording a 61-52 victory in Hamilton.

item.title: Kangaroos equal winning record with 46-point Saints drubbing, Cats down Dogs, Pies and Blues notch wins
item.description: North Melbourne equals the VFL/AFL record for consecutive wins and claims the AFLW minor premiership with a 46-point drubbing of St Kilda.

item.title: Australia's Jillaroos defeat Fetū Sāmoa 60-0 in Pacific Championships Test
item.description: The Jillaroos show why they are world champions, recording a dominant 60-0 victory over Fetū Sāmoa in Brisbane.

item.title: Thousands left without power as tornado hits Melbourne, bringing the biggest rainfall in 18 months
item.description: Tens of thousands of Victorians were left without power and a tornado swept through Melbourne's west on a wild day of weather.

item.title: Samoa defeats Tonga 34-6 to qualify for Pacific Cup final as lightning wreaks havoc
item.description: Samoa defeats Tonga 34-6 after a 95-minute lightning delay at Lang Park.

item.title: Surfboard found intact in New Zealand after being lost in Tasmania in 2024
item.description: A barnacle-covered surfboard that spent 17 months at sea and travelled from Tasmania to New Zealand after it was lost off a boat appears set to be reunited with its owner.

item.title: Paedophiles exploiting Australia's broken childcare system as safeguards crumble
item.description: The true scale of abuse in Australia's childcare centres has been hidden. With 200,000 pages of previously confidential files, police tip-offs, and evidence from whistleblowers, Four Corners exposes the reality.

item.title: Trump's rare earths deal to counter China was a badly needed 'Sputnik moment'
item.description: To remind the US president: China is both communist and working passably well, something he and the United States generally are being forced reluctantly to confront.

item.title: 'Bad for humanity, good for business': Australian firms help Europe arm for war
item.description: As European countries rush to shore up their defences amid relentless fighting in Ukraine and a growing Russian "shadow" threat, companies here are capitalising on the age of drone warfare.

item.title: Senior Queensland doctor suspended for more than a year on full pay
item.description: Chief medical officer Charles Pain vows to clear his name after going to the Industrial Relations Commission to find out the allegations against him.

item.title: Environment laws are biggest test of parliament since Albanese's win
item.description: The Coalition goes into the sitting fortnight managing grievance and division. Labor carries the weight of needing to prove it can manage the parliament. It is not hard to work out who you would prefer to be this week.

item.title: Labor rejects Coalition request to split environmental reforms
item.description: Opposition leader Sussan Ley wrote to the government on Sunday to suggest its environmental reforms be split into two to prioritise "practical measures to streamline approvals".

item.title: Federal government rules out changing copyright law to give AI companies free rein
item.description: Labor has ruled out changing copyright laws to give tech giants free rein to train artificial intelligence models on creative works after the proposition was met with widespread backlash from artists.

item.title: Growing calls to introduce dog day care, walking and training mandatory standards in NSW
item.description: Animal welfare experts are calling for mandatory qualifications and regulation of dog day care, walking and training services in NSW, as the industry booms.

item.title: Trump, trade and security on agenda for Anthony Albanese at ASEAN summit
item.description: Anthony Albanese arrives in Kuala Lumpur, following in the footsteps of US President Donald Trump, who is also at the summit.

item.title: Could species-specific fish 'hotels' help save Australia's freshwater populations? This spring could hold the answer
item.description: This spring offers a critical window to see if man-made "bungalows" installed in rivers can help a struggling fish species. If they work, they could provide a path forward for restoring other battling Australian freshwater fish populations.

item.title: Teenagers struggle to tell if videos are real or fake as AI floods social media
item.description: BTN High puts teenagers to the test to see if they can spot if videos are fake or real. It was harder than the high schoolers thought.

item.title: New Zealand's Sophie Devine plays her final ODI in Women's World Cup loss to England
item.description: New Zealand's Sophie Devine, one of the stars of international women's cricket, plays her last ODI, suffering defeat to England at the World Cup.

item.title: Federal politics: Coalition targets Labor on CFMEU as chamber breaks out in giggles during Question Time — as it happened
item.description: The Coalition pressures the government in Question Time over the effectiveness of the CFMEU administrator and calls on Labor to deregister the organisation. Take a look back at the day's coverage here.

item.title: ASX gained on 'constructive' trade talks, rare earths dumped, ACCC hauls Microsoft into court over Office 365 subscriptions — as it happened
item.description: "Constructive" talks between US and Chinese trade negotiations ahead of a meeting between Trump and Xi have lifted global share markets.

item.title: North West Queensland is rich in critical minerals. Will it benefit from the Trump deal?
item.description: A multi-billion-dollar critical minerals partnership between Australia and the US is touted as a landmark industry deal and is expected to speed up projects in minerally rich outback Queensland.

item.title: Chess grandmaster Vladimir Kramnik files complaint over online threats
item.description: Former world chess champion Vladimir Kramnik has asked Swiss authorities to investigate threatening messages posted online following the sudden death of US grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky.

item.title: British MPs consider motion to strip Prince Andrew of Duke of York title
item.description: It comes amid mounting speculation that King Charles III may force his younger brother out of his long-time home on Windsor Castle.

item.title: Family demands answers after patient with dementia found dead in river
item.description: The family of a 73-year-old man, who was found dead in a river after leaving a New South Wales hospital, believes his death was preventable and that it has been let down by the medical system.

item.title: Five simple questions the NT government won't answer after ABC investigation
item.description: Three weeks after an ABC investigation raised allegations against the NT's gambling commission, the government is refusing to answer straightforward questions about what's being done – if anything.

item.title: Former diplomat Lachlan Strahan shares insider's take on Solomon Islands-China deal in memoir
item.description: Former diplomat Lachlan Strahan used his memoir to criticise parts of the Coalition government's response to Solomon Islands' 2022 deal with China, while revealing some Australian officials pushed to impose "punitive" measures on Solomon Islands if it deepened security cooperation with China.

item.title: Planetarium and observatory planned for Australia's only dark sky reserve
item.description: Amid the global rise of "noctourism", the country's only officially listed dark sky reserve is working on an ambitious proposal for an underground planetarium and observatory.

item.title: WA neurosurgeon shortage delaying surgery for vulnerable spinal patients
item.description: A Perth man's wait for surgery to treat painful pressure sores exposes delays and specialist shortages in Western Australia's spinal care system.

item.title: Thousands without power as Brisbane swelters through 39-degree heat after wild storms
item.description: Tens of thousands of homes remain without power after destructive storms, as south-east Queensland swelters through another scorcher. The mercury in parts of Brisbane reached 39.1 degrees Celsius, on par with the hottest October day since 1957.

item.title: Dangerously Modern at the Art Gallery of New South Wales re-centres women in the history of Australian art
item.description: At the turn of the century, Australian women artists travelled to Europe and returned with new styles and techniques. Their long-overlooked contribution to Australian art is celebrated in Dangerously Modern.

item.title: Australia looking for improvement in second Ashes Test, despite losing skipper Isaah Yeo
item.description: Isaah Yeo's head knock will keep him out of the second Ashes Test with England but Australia is determined to improve, even without their inspirational leader.

item.title: Tributes flow for New York Jets legend Nick Mangold after former NFL star dies aged 41
item.description: An emotional Rex Ryan pays tribute to New York Jets champion Nick Mangold, who died aged 41 on the weekend.

item.title: Australian captain Pat Cummins out of first Ashes Test, will return to bowling this week
item.description: Pat Cummins is officially ruled out of the first Ashes Test against England, with Steve Smith named to step in as skipper in Perth.

item.title: ACCC sues Microsoft for allegedly misleading millions of Australians with Microsoft 365 subscription hikes
item.description: The consumer watchdog is suing Microsoft for allegedly misleading about 2.7 million Australians over its Microsoft 365 subscriptions.

item.title: Carbon credit profits used to fund restoration around UNESCO biosphere reserve
item.description: A decades-long conservation project restoring vegetation between two renowned national parks could be accelerated using the carbon economy.

item.title: Golden golfers a hit in the red dirt of this Broome backyard
item.description: A daily round of golf and gardening in the red soils of Broome keeps this chipper couple on a healthy course.

item.title: Coastal repairs underway for eroded beach on NSW far south coast
item.description: Scientists hope the ocean current will help to replenish sand missing from a NSW beach decimated by recent storms.

item.title: Snow lands at low altitudes across Hobart suburbs and surrounding areas in 'uncommon' sight
item.description: Snow has fallen in Hobart suburbs, including Sandy Bay and Glenorchy, in a "relatively uncommon" sight, the weather bureau says.

item.title: Australian Facebook users could claim part of this $50m privacy breach payout
item.description: Right now, more than 311,000 Australian Facebook users can apply for a slice of a $50 million compensation fund from tech giant Meta — the largest ever payment for a breach of Australians' privacy.

item.title: Mum suffers 'chemical exposure' after moving into Housing Trust property
item.description: An Adelaide mum says she and her son experienced wheezing, dry-retching and burning in the throat after moving into a drug-contaminated Housing Trust property she was told had been cleaned and maintained.

item.title: Northern hairy-nosed wombat joeys mark conservation success for rare Queensland animal
item.description: Three wild-born northern hairy-nosed wombats born in Powrunna State Forest mark a new chapter in the species' recovery from near extinction.

item.title: Liam Lawson narrowly misses track marshals running across F1 Mexico City Grand Prix track
item.description: A camera captures the terrifying moment two track marshals run in front of Liam Lawson's car during Formula 1's Mexico City Grand Prix.

item.description: One Moto3 rider is facing "multiple surgeries" after an horrific crash at the Malaysian MotoGP. Warning — graphic footage.

item.description: Australia's Lani Pallister says an autograph she got as a 12-year-old helped inspire her to set a swimming world record.

item.title: North Melbourne's AFLW dominance is a tide to lift all boats
item.description: While some suggest that this year's AFLW premiers being all but known has caused some to lose interest, commentators say North Melbourne's dominance is inspirational.

item.description: A volunteer ski patrol captain raises concerns for public safety as part of measures to cut costs at Victoria's Mount Stirling Alpine Resort, which has operated at a deficit for years.

item.title: Spirit of Tasmania operator sent wrong fender specs, leading to $9 million ferry fix

item.title: Who is Catherine Connolly, Ireland's new left-leaning, independent president-elect?
item.description: The 68-year-old former barrister is known for being one of the leading pro-Palestinian voices in the Irish parliament.

item.title: As South-East Asia reels from tariffs, Donald Trump's flashy 'peace' deal falls short
item.description: The US president, who is on a lightning tour of South-East Asia this week, casts a long shadow in the region. But even as he signs deals, nations are contemplating a future without him.

item.title: Oscar Piastri loses F1 lead, but hope remains in his battles against Lando Norris and Max Verstappen
item.description: Oscar Piastri has lost his lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship. Despite momentum working against the Australian, there are still plenty of reasons to believe he can win the world title.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa threatens catastrophic flooding in Jamaica and Haiti
item.description: The category five storm is threatening to unleash torrential rain and catastrophic flooding in the northern Caribbean, including Haiti and Jamaica.

item.title: NSW inquiry into unsolved murders, missing persons will divert police resources, Homicide Squad chief says
item.description: NSW Police Force Homicide Squad boss Joe Doueihi is concerned the state parliamentary inquiry will create an "excessive or extra workload" for investigators.

item.title: What do we know about the investigation into the jewel heist at the Louvre?
item.description: What do we know about the investigation into the jewel heist at the Louvre and what are some of the possible consequences?

item.title: Cost-of-living crisis and 'weight of the world' means we're socialising less than ever
item.description: Data from the latest HILDA survey indicate socialising rates have dropped over the past two decades, and, more recently, have not returned to pre-COVID frequency.

item.title: Anthony Albanese raised concerns over 'unsafe' military encounter with Chinese premier
item.description: Anthony Albanese sat down with Premier Li Qiang — China's second most senior leader — on the sidelines of the ASEAN meeting in Kuala Lumpur on Monday morning.

item.title: WA tops State of the States economic performance report, despite weak economic growth
item.description: Western Australia again secures the top gong as Australia's best performing economy according to a new report by the Commonwealth Bank, despite the state recording some of the country's weakest economic growth.

item.title: Proposal to change building height restrictions in Adelaide CBD
item.description: Adelaide's skyline will be "sent soaring" by changes to building height rules that will make it easier for developers to add extra storeys to CBD construction projects, the SA government says.

item.title: The NuvaRing contraceptive is going on the PBS. Here's how that may impact you
item.description: Including the NuvaRing on the PBS will slash the cost of contraception for tens of thousands of Australians by around two-thirds.

item.title: The Western democratic world is at a 'civilisational moment'
item.description: In his 2025 Boyer Lecture, former deputy prime minister John Anderson reflects on democracy and the end of the liberal global order.

item.title: Firefighters stop spread of out-of-control Bushfire in Northern NSW
item.description: The warning for a bushfire in northern New South Wales has been downgraded after it threatened to reach Emergency Warning level amid deteriorating weather conditions on Monday afternoon.

item.title: California Governor Gavin Newsom to consider 2028 US presidential run
item.description: The California Governor says he will make a decision after the 2026 midterm elections.

item.title: Sanjeev Gupta urged to pay debts or sell Tahmoor mine as workers go unpaid
item.description: More than half the workforce at a coal mine owned by embattled British billionaire Sanjeev Gupta have been stood down without pay, with the union demanding immediate action.

item.title: Australia's crumbling childcare safeguards put kids at risk. How can parents make sure they are safe?
item.description: The scale of Australia's childcare crisis is deeply distressing for parents. These are the simple questions to ask any childcare provider to know if your child is safe.

item.title: Virginia Roberts Giuffre's brothers say Jeffrey Epstein's cameras captured crimes, demand they be released
item.description: Virginia Roberts Giuffre's brothers are calling for the Epstein files, which they believe include videotapes, to be released. One says he knew for years about her allegation against their father.

item.title: Environmental watchdog drops charges against company responsible for burning Kealba landfill fire
item.description: A company responsible for a tip that has been on fire for nearly six years may be allowed to keep its landfill licence, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Arnold Schwarzenegger accuses US states of trying to 'out-cheat' each other under Trump
item.description: Former California governor Arnold Schwarzenegger has expressed concern over the "crazy gerrymandering" that is taking place across the US.

item.title: Why Cam Green staying at No.3 could help get the best out of Steve Smith during the 2025/26 Ashes
item.description: With Cam Green and Steve Smith shaping as the mostly likely candidates to be selected as Australia's No.3 for this summer's Ashes, selectors face a choice between pragmatism and tradition.

item.title: Man accused of lighting Mount Gambier Valley Lake bushfire while wearing mask and cape denied bail
item.description: Police allege a 37-year-old man lit six fires at Valley Lake, near Mount Gambier, at night while wearing a silver cape and a black mask, after allegedly stealing a cask of wine from a liquor store.

item.title: Argentina's Javier Milei wins in decisive midterms as Trump loan looms large
item.description: Argentina's libertarian President Javier Milei has won decisive victories in the midterm elections, in an election where Donald Trump loomed large.

item.title: Fans miss Diljit Dosanjh's Western Sydney concert over 'hurtful' religious dagger ban
item.description: Concertgoers who had tickets to see an Indian music superstar have been offered a refund after refusing to leave their Sikh dagger at the gate.

item.title: Damage control as Bureau of Meteorology defends widely criticised new website
item.description: In a week of wild weather across the country, the Bureau of Meteorology's new website missed the mark.

item.title: Tens of thousands of people without power as south-east Queensland suffers heat, fires, smoke a day after storm hits
item.description: More than 25,000 people are without power after south-east Queensland has been hit by storms, smoke, fires and winds.

item.title: Perth and WA faces sliced bread shortage after fire disrupts Tip Top factory
item.description: A fire at an industrial bread facility in Perth's south causes a shortage of sliced bread on supermarket shelves across Western Australia.

item.title: Virginia Giuffre's brothers pledge to fight for justice
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: RBA governor Bullock says a severe market downturn would raise financial stability concerns
item.description: The Reserve Bank governor tells a Sydney gathering of economists she and her overseas counterparts are perplexed by what they call "sanguine" financial markets. They question is whether it will "all end in tears".

item.title: Lithuania vows to shoot down Belarus smuggler balloons disrupting air traffic
item.description: Lithuania has drawn up plans to shut its border crossings with Belarus indefinitely, after the capital's airport was repeatedly disrupted by suspected sightings of balloons carrying contraband cigarettes.

item.title: Ten people face trial accused of cyberbullying French president's wife Brigitte Macron
item.description: Ten people to go on trial over cyberbullying of French President Emmanuel Macron's wife Brigitte Macron after they allegedly made "malicious" comments online spreading claims she is a man.

item.title: Donald Trump says he 'would love' third term but rules out running for vice-president in 2028
item.description: US President Donald Trump has ruled out running for vice-president in 2028, which some supporters have suggested could see him circumvent a constitutional bar against serving a third term.

item.title: Katy Perry and Justin Trudeau seen holding hands leaving Paris club
item.description: The pair's public appearance on the pop singer's 41st birthday has added fuel to growing speculation the two are in a relationship.

item.title: Japan asks army to cull bears after spike in attacks on humans
item.description: A record number of fatal attacks has prompted one regional leader to call for more help in dealing with the problem.

item.title: Knife-detecting wands not used by Tasmania Police on night of fatal stabbing near Salamanca
item.description: Tasmania Police confirms despite five knife-detecting wands being available, none were being used by officers in Hobart on the night of an alleged stabbing murder.

item.title: Top firefighters warn West Gate Tunnel not safe until proper checks completed
item.description: Victoria's emergency services are unprepared for critical incidents in Melbourne's soon-to-be-opened West Gate Tunnel, senior firefighters warn.

item.title: Heckler asks King Charles how long he knew about 'Andrew and Epstein'
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: How the Sydney 2000 Games changed the Paralympic media landscape in Australia
item.description: In the year 2000, few things would have pushed back the nightly ABC News bulletin. When a wheelchair race did, legendary broadcaster Karen Tighe knew the Paralympics had truly arrived in Australia.

item.title: Is it cheaper to end poverty than to maintain it? Research says yes
item.description: In 2020, Australia massively increased welfare payments and conducted a live experiment in ending poverty, but when the subsidy was removed, many were thrown back into hardship. Leaving aside the moral dimension, would it be cheaper to end poverty than to maintain it?

item.title: Israeli families wait for release of remaining hostages in Gaza
item.description: The father of one of the dead hostages still in Gaza says he does not trust Hamas's assurances it is doing all it can to find and return the remains of Israelis.

item.title: On the dark web, paedophiles are sharing tips on how to abuse children in child care
item.description: Paedophiles are using the dark web to share information about how to gain access to childcare centres to sexually abuse babies and toddlers while avoiding getting caught.

item.title: Benjamin Netanyahu has rejected 'Bibi-sitting' claims but the US is watching Israel closely
item.description: Some of the most senior officials from the US arriving in Israel has prompted some to re-imagine the phrase "Bibi-sitting" — and question the motive behind it.

item.title: Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson labelled 'hypocrites' by royal biographer over connection to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Prince Andrew is a "hypocrite" who believes he is above the law, according to author Andrew Lownie, who has written an unauthorised biography on the under siege royal.

item.title: Russia's interest in Antarctic oil exposed after Ukrainian scientist's arrest
item.description: A document linked to the arrest of a scientist has raised questions about whether Russia has long-term ambitions to exploit oil resources in Antarctica, where mining is banned indefinitely.

item.title: Kids 'left in the dark' in family law matters, as Family Court of Australia makes new commitment
item.description: Sally's legal battle in the Federal Circuit and Family Court of Australia may be years long gone, but the trauma of the experience lingers — especially on her eldest child.

item.title: Temperatures plummet across Queensland after record-breaking heat
item.description: A cool change on Tuesday will provide welcome relief after the extreme heat as thousands remain without power across the state.

item.title: Labor has pivoted from health to housing. How will SA voters respond?
item.description: If Labor’s 2022 campaign was all about ambulance patients locked out of hospitals, then 2026 is all about young people locked out of home ownership.

item.title: Survivors of paedophile teacher Peter Farmer sue Victorian Education Department
item.description: Victims of a paedophile who used children's artwork to hide abuse are suing the Victorian Education Department, alleging his abuse should have been stopped earlier.

item.title: Parts of the Brisbane suburb Woolloongabba, which has been earmarked as a priority area for housing ahead of the 2032 Olympics, flood regularly.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Queensland government drops special flood measures in Woolloongabba ahead of 2032 Olympics
item.description: Experts say changes by the Queensland government could ease construction costs by removing what the property industry describe as "unnecessary" restrictions, while residents could be left wearing the fallout.

item.title: Matildas to face England in Derby in first clash since Women's World Cup semi-final
item.description: Ella Toone's goal helped England break Australian hearts at the 2023 Women's World Cup. She knows, and Steph Catley admits, the Matildas are out for "revenge".

item.title: Federal politics live: MP Julian Leeser says Four Corners childcare investigation was 'chilling', calls for bipartisan support
item.description: Shadow Early Learning Minister Julian Leeser says the Four Corners investigation into predators in child care is "one of the most chilling things I have ever seen on television". Follow live.

item.title: Why the RBA should put a handbrake on property prices
item.description: Whether or not we're delivered a rate cut next Tuesday, there's a solid argument that the RBA should once again consider using its powers to curb runaway real estate prices.

item.title: Hurricane Melissa could be strongest recorded storm to hit Jamaica
item.description: Having intensified into a category five system, Hurricane Melissa looks set to be the strongest hurricane to hit Jamaica since record-keeping began in 1851.

item.title: Never seen before hurricane wreaks havoc in Jamaica
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Two people dead after underground Endeavor Mine explosion at Cobar, western NSW
item.description: Authorities are investigating a fatal underground mine explosion in western NSW.

item.title: Two people dead after underground Endeavor Mine explosion at Cobar, western NSW
item.description: Authorities are investigating a fatal underground mine explosion in western NSW.

item.title: King Charles heckled over brother Prince Andrew's ties to sex offender Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: The protester outside the cathedral could also be heard saying "have you asked the police to cover up for Andrew, sir?"

item.title: Teens with disabilities are worried about the social media ban becoming another barrier in their lives
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Alexei Popyrin loses to Alexander Bublik in Paris, before Australian snubbed for post-match handshake
item.description: Alexei Popyrin is knocked out of the Paris Masters, while the victorious Alexander Bublik walks off court without acknowledging the Australian.

item.title: Remote councils threaten to disrupt $2.6b remote jobs program due to start next week
item.description: Three Aboriginal Northern Territory councils say they will cancel leases critical to the rollout of the federal government's new jobs program after they claim they were overlooked for funding because they were "not Aboriginal enough".

item.title: Brain cancer patient's tumour growth halted after immunotherapy identified by molecular testing
item.description: Emma's brain tumour has stopped growing since she gained access to a type of immunotherapy identified by molecular testing.

item.title: Victorian government to reopen controversial Malmsbury centre as youth crime surges
item.description: The Victorian government is reopening the Malmsbury Youth Justice Centre less than two years after closing the facility, which was plagued by riots and escape attempts.

item.title: Markets live updates: US markets at records, global stocks rally on hopes of easing China tensions
item.description: The three key US indices close at record highs as China tensions ease. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

item.title: WA Governor Chris Dawson to apologise to traditional owners for Pinjarra Massacre
item.description: The descendants of people who were murdered in one of Western Australia's most brutal attacks on Aboriginal people — the Pinjarra Massacre — are set to hear an apology from the WA governor.

item.title: Families of WWI soldiers set to be reunited with a century-old letters uncovered on WA beach
item.description: Family members of two World War I soldiers have been left stunned after a bottle containing their hand-written letters was found on a WA beach.

item.title: Angle Park Vet Clinic owners 'strongly dispute' claims of substandard care
item.description: Owners of an SA vet clinic say claims it provided substandard treatment to retired greyhounds, which the racing regulator allegedly ignored, "misrepresent" its procedures.

item.title: Athletes call for climate change action as Adapt2win campaign launched ahead of Cop30
item.description: Ahead of next month's COP30 in Brazil, sports stars from around the world have helped to launch a campaign urging for action on climate change.

item.title: City of Sydney to investigate reducing short-term rental cap to 60 days a year
item.description: City of Sydney already has a 180-day cap on un-hosted short-term rentals, but some councillors say it's not doing enough to free up housing stock.

item.title: Fears planned salt work expansion could threaten internationally significant wetlands
item.description: There are concerns plans to expand salt mining operations on a wetland that stretches from Carnarvon to the Ningaloo Coast could cause environmental damage.
